instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700-A u9020 getting very hot, no boot.
threads.message:
PPBUS shorted 
I cleared it. 
now I saw a little hole on the nand ic
The nand ic is getting very hot. 
pls can it be replace or I need to do some sought golf programming. Thanks

threads.title: 820-01700-A u9020 getting very hot, no boot.
threads.message:
There are videos on Internet about changing NANDs.

You will need to pick the chip from donor board, same position.
We don't have yet positive feedback left on the forum about this.

threads.title: 820-01700-A u9020 getting very hot, no boot.
threads.message:
So it not possible to replace it? Since there is no positive feedback. Just wanted to know possible or not.
I tried to fix two nand chip of same board 
After dfu. I got the operation….(Amrestore….error 6- failed to ….  And it’s same board same side but not precise about the position. Should I give it another try or it’s not possible

threads.title: 820-01700-A u9020 getting very hot, no boot.
threads.message: People claimed on Internet that only worked with chip from same position.
